So that’s what the #ForThePeople agenda for this week looked like. House Democrats are committed to improving the everyday lives of hardworking men and women. This is something we will never stop doing.

Long-term healthcare: 

Long-term #healthcare is broken. The system is a mess. 

The @EnergyCommerce committee held a markup on my provisions that will solve this problem, and help the millions who struggle with this issue. 

It’s time they get the support they need.
RAWA will put forward bold solutions and provide money to states to save species like the monarch butterflies and other animals we hold dear to our hearts. #RecoverWildlife

The Recovering America’s Wildlife Act (RAWA): 

As many of you know, our wildlife is slowly dying. That’s why I introduced strong, bipartisan legislation that will reinforce our commitment to preserve our nations wildlife.
My three Amendments (bipartisan as well) will stop us from kicking the can down the road when it comes to #PFAS contamination. It will provide real change.

First up, efforts to combat PFAS contamination:

If you’re from Michigan, you know #PFAS has contaminated our waters and is an issue for many people. 3 of my amendments that will ensure we take real steps and tackle this crisis head on were included in the NDAA (Defense bill)

Many of you see the #ForThePeople, and might be curious what it means. Let me lay out to you some of the #ForThePeople accomplishments of the Democratic House this week. Some are small, some are big, but they provide real help to hardworking men and women.

Pleased that the house passed three of my Amendments that would take real steps to clean up #PFAS chemicals once and for all. These amendments will ensure we stop kicking the can down the road and tackle this crisis head on. It’s time we get serious about clean up.

I understand what the ACA means to too many families – it’s life and death for millions of Americans. It’s why I fight and won’t stop until every American has quality, affordable healthcare. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/10/upshot/overturning-obamacare-unexpected-results.html …

With 100 new PFAS contamination sites identified, the total is now over 700 nationwide. If it wasn’t clear before, it should be clear now. We are facing a PFAS crisis. There is no time for further inaction – my #NDAA provisions would be a true beginning to addressing the crisis.

We’re live with @JeffFortenberry and conservation groups to reintroduce the Recovering America’s Wildlife Act. Tune in! https://www.pscp.tv/w/b_iJsTFkclFlR21EcGFqYkd8MWVhS2J2QU1BV2pLWK21rfZZC6YwpnQnB-WJDUWFDNSeM4PMW9LB2WSUYjWT …

Answer: The House just passed the SAFE Act – a bill to help strengthen the security & integrity of US elections. Democrat or Republican, our democracy depends on voters knowing their votes will count. #AskDebbieDingell https://debbiedingell.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=1786 …
Question from Instagram: Is there a real bipartisan commitment to election security or is it only an issue with Democrats? pic.twitter.com/dM9v2oep9f

Answer: House-passed HR 1, the For the People Act, requires Election Day be treated as a federal holiday. It is critical that we work to reduce barriers to voting. #AskDebbieDingell pic.twitter.com/TcZxqHDRAb
Question from Instagram: Will you fight to make election day a federal holiday? #AskDebbieDingell pic.twitter.com/tUXVDZsZiu

Securing our elections should be a bipartisan issue. The Mueller report made it clear – Russia interfered during the 2016 elections. It's time McConnell held a vote to protect a fundamental pillar of our democracy. #AskDebbieDingell pic.twitter.com/GNnGzny0cj

Question from Facebook: If McConnell continues to block any action on this, what can be done to insure that there is no external (foreign) interference in our elections?... #AskDebbieDingell pic.twitter.com/iVVMD7wctF
H.R. 1 would do just that. In Congress I also introduced a bill that requires every vote produces a paper receipt.  #AskDebbieDingell https://twitter.com/mnykaza/status/1146147965842657281 …

Answer: It’s the responsibility of each state to maintain voter registration. Now to your questions. Because a fundamental part of democracy is transparent conversations with your elected leaders. Let's get to some questions on securing our elections. #AskDebbieDingell
This week, the week we celebrate our independence, we have to commit to protecting the freedoms we all hold so dear.
Voting is a fundamental pillar of democracy. The fight to remove barriers to the ballot-box has been long, but every step has brought us towards a more equal democracy.

The #ForthePeople Act (passed by the House in March) takes great steps to return the power of government to the people. HR 1 secures elections, reduces the influence of big money in politics, and strengthens government ethics laws. https://debbiedingell.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=1694 …

Further, I have strong legislation (Safeguarding Election Infrastructure Act) which ensures states have the resources and intelligence necessary to protect voting equipment and safeguard our elections from outside interference. https://debbiedingell.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=1024 …

Recently, the House passed strong legislation to strengthen the security & integrity of US elections. The SAFE Act provides funding to protect election infrastructure, requires paper ballots, and defends against foreign interference in domestic elections. https://debbiedingell.house.gov/news/documentsingle.aspx?DocumentID=1786 …
When I was sworn into Congress, I took an oath to defend our country from threats foreign and domestic. This is the time for everyone - Democrat and Republican to step up and protect the ballot-box.

The Mueller Report made it clear - Russia interfered in the 2016 elections, and still foreign actors are attempting to divide us and threaten voting. We can't ignore the evidence and must ensure this fundamental pillar of our democracy is sacred.

Welcome everyone to a conversation on election security! By signing the Declaration of Independence, our Founders asserted self-government free from foreign influence and interference. 243 years later - it's on us to deliver that promise. #AskDebbieDingell pic.twitter.com/qX0fcDAlna

HAPPENING SOON: I will be hosting a Twitter townhall on election security at 5:00PM ET. Follow along to hear about work in Congress to keep the ballot box safe! #AskDebbieDingell. pic.twitter.com/lRWjmXPZtm
